org.mitre.provenance.tools

Class PLUSUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.mitre.provenance.tools.PLUSUtils

  • public class PLUSUtils
extends Object
    This is a garbage can class, with utility methods relevant to different places in the code.
    Author:
    DMALLEN

      • generateRawUUID

        public static String generateRawUUID()
        Generate a raw identifier used in PLUS object IDs
        Returns:
        a String unique identifier (UUID, time-based random number)

      • generateID

        public static String generateID()
        Generate a new random UUID suitable for identifying data items and invocations.
        Returns:
        a guaranteed unique string UUID

      • isPLUSOID

        public static boolean isPLUSOID(String identifier)
        Determines whether a given identifier is a valid PLUS object ID (OID). Valid PLUS OIDs are generated by this class, and always contain PLUS_OID_PREFIX
        Parameters:
        identifier - the identifier to check
        Returns:
        true if the identifier is a PLUS OID, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        PLUS_OID_PREFIX, generateID()

      • printOutput

        public static void printOutput(Process p)
                        throws IOException
        Read the data available from a process, and print it to stdout.
        Parameters:
        p - the process to read from.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • unpackQueryString

        public static HashMap<String,String> unpackQueryString(String queryString)
        Takes a query string (in HTTP GET style) and returns a HashMap of its contents. Performs URLDecoding on all values (but not keys). So for example, if passed x=1&y=2&z=3, it will return a HashMap with 3 keys (x, y, and z) with corresponding values.
        Parameters:
        queryString - an HTTP GET-style query string.
        Returns:
        a HashMap of its contents

      • shortNameForURL

        public static String shortNameForURL(String url)
        Deprecated. 

      • inputStreamToString

        public static String inputStreamToString(InputStream is)
                                  throws IOException
        Deprecated. 
        Utility method for helping with JXTA messages. Take an input stream, and return its entire contents as a string. Don't do this for very large input streams, because it's all in memory.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • join

        public static String join(String delim,
                          Object[] col)
        Deprecated. 

      • normalizeExternalIdentifier

        public static String normalizeExternalIdentifier(String id)
        PLUS sometimes takes identifiers passed by other systems, which may be in any number of encoding schemes, including URL, URI, and PLUS OID. This method normalizes the identifier into something that is most likely to be found by the database.
        Parameters:
        id - the ID to normalize
        Returns:
        the best PLUS representation of the same ID.

      • describeTimeSpan

        public static String describeTimeSpan(long elapsedMS)
        Take a number of elapsed milliseconds, and describe it as a string.
        Parameters:
        elapsedMS - a number of milliseconds elapsed.
        Returns:
        a string of the form "X years, Y months, Z days, (etc)"

      • normalizeURI

        public static URI normalizeURI(String uri)
                        throws URISyntaxException,
                               UnsupportedEncodingException
        Normalizes a URI as specified in section 6.2.2 of RFC 3986
        Parameters:
        uri - a URI
        Returns:
        an RFC 3986 URI normalized according to section 6.2.2.
        Throws:
        URISyntaxException
        UnsupportedEncodingException

      • normalizeURI

        public static URI normalizeURI(URI uri)
                        throws URISyntaxException,
                               UnsupportedEncodingException
        Normalizes a URI as specified in section 6.2.2 of RFC 3986. At present, this does nothing for opaque URIs (such as URNs, and mailto:foo@bar.com). For non-opaque URIs, it standardizes the case of escaped octets, hostname, fixes port references, alphebetizes and properly encodes query string parameters, and resolves relative paths.
        Parameters:
        uri - a URI
        Returns:
        an RFC 3986 URI normalized according to section 6.2.2.
        Throws:
        URISyntaxException
        UnsupportedEncodingException
